intro: Pseudognaphalium microcephalum var. thermale, commonly known as the thermophilic everlasting flower, is a flowering plant native to warm regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often found in sunny, well-drained soils. It is known for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in high-temperature environments. Its foliage is typically gray-green, with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss.
